climbs.name: Wrist Rocket
climbs.fa: John Cook, Brad Young, Kathy Cook 10-4-18 established Ground Up

content.description: Start by stemming between formations and stepping onto the tower. Extend the first draw, then move down and around to a crumbly stance. Clip bolt 2 and make a balancy move up and into the crumbly, large "cutout". Bolt 3 protects another balancy mantle-ish move to the last good stance before the crumbly slab finish. Clip bolt 4, take a breath and crumble your way to the top. This route may need 50 or so ascents to clean up.
content.location: This route is on the east side of the Slingshot Arete tower/pinnacle.

content.description:
Climb the slab to the ledge where the first bolt is, about 20 ft. up.

Face climb up the seam. Crux is at the 2nd bolt. The climbing isn't too hard, but clipping the 2nd bolt is kinda awkward. After that the climbing eases to 5.7
content.location: On the west face of Pauls Backyard, between the north face and the Hillbilly pillar

content.description: This is a fun route with slabby moves to the first bolt and wonderful thick plates that lead to one more bolt within the plated section.
content.protection: Two bolts total, shares the thread anchor with the next route to its right.
content.location:
On a slab west of Paul's Backyard, right of the route currently known as

Unknown (aka 'Bittersweet Feet')

.

content.description: This ugly little thing is to the left of 'Sweet Pete' (approx. 20 feet) and climbs the blunt arete on the slab to a pair of bolts (one with a mussey hook and the other a bolt with chain???)
Climb easy slab past five bolts up the center of the slab.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor (screwlinks).
content.location: This is on a short slab just west of Paul's Backyard parking and down right of "Ted Shred".

content.protection: 4 bolts, red Alien, and/or #2 TCU or equivalent. Two ring Fixe anchor.
content.location: Left side of the wall, left of "Gun Rail," at a right leaning flared crack/seam.

content.description: From the parking area if you look to the SW, Ted Shred, is the left leaning finger crack in the slab. Climb the crack and numerous features on the face. The crack steepens and opens up near the top.
On the far left of the formation, follow 5 bolts to anchor.

climbs.name: Slingshot Arete
climbs.fa: B. Bindner, E. Holland, T. Standing 02/10/2008

content.description: Climb the arete of the free-standing "boulder" in the parking area just east of Paul's Paradise, passing four bolts to the anchor. The crux is near the top.  The route gets its name from the method we used to first get to the top of this pinnacle... I used a slingshot to get a light nylon line over the top of the formation. I then hauled a climbing rope over the top, whence Nurse Ratchet gave me a belay on the easier east face.  Established top down, hand drilling.
content.location: This boulder/pinnacle is located in the parking area. Look for bolts on the north arete, to the right of the fire ring.

content.description: Easy face climbing up plates (5.2) for about 25 feet, then another 40 feet of low angle slab (5.3 at first, then continually easier)
content.location: This route starts just left of the wide crack that is 12 feet left of the bolts on Bittersweet Feet. Climb along the right side of the face on good plates. Sling the largest 2 plates and transition to slab. Continue up until it is easy to transition over to the slab about 15 feet directly above the anchor for Bittersweet Feet. Scramble down to the anchor for Bittersweet Feet. There is a knob/horn on the right side of the crack that works well as a directional for the rope (at the same height as the anchor). This line has probably been free soloed in the past, so I am not claiming it as a FA. It is easy and fun.

content.description:
Climb the face under an arch or the right-side of the arch, then up past 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

This is to the left of "Ted Shred".

The North Face route climbs the steep flared seam, right of center of Paul's Backyard. Climb the seam and features on either side to reach a high first bolt. Continue pulling plates and edges to the anchors.
Route (name and FA party not known at this time) established sometime in 2008.  Route is not listed in the new Bishop Area Rock Climbs guidebook.
content.location: Face route located between "North Face" and "Haf n Haf" in Paul's backyard.

content.description: Getting into the crack is the crux. Climb the crack, then up grainy face past a bolt to the anchor.
content.location: This is the right slanting crack just right of Paul's Paradise North Face.

content.description: Standard pulling on some solid but grainy rock.  Nice addition to the crag.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a shared anchor with Annie Get Your Gun
content.location: Just about 8ft right of Annie Get Your Gun, the 4 bolt route on the left end of the crag.

content.description: Start just below a somewhat large broken flake/hole and work your way up to the first bolt. Make a few intermediate moves to reach the second bolt. From here (the crux), rocker up and latch onto the "rail" above on the thin patina plate. Continue to work up, moving slighty right then back left to reach bigger holds. Clip the 3rd and final bolt...you're home free!
content.protection:
- (3) bolts

- Anchors bolts equipped with rings
content.location: This fine addition to Paul's Paradise is located on the north facing end, 10 feet left of the bolted route called 'Unknown' (5.9). Additionally, it can be identified by five bullet holes near the first bolt.

content.description: A shortie that has pretty good hand jams and foot jams. We used it as practice for gear placements and setting belay anchors. Definitely not one you need to do here but great for teaching a friend about trad.
content.location: Four cracks left of teds shred

content.description: This follows 5 bolts just right of "Sweet Pete".

Start climbing on large positive holds to a 6" diameter hole ten feet off the deck.. Pull through the bulge to more large holds and a high step. The angle eases with more large flakes leading to the anchor.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.
